ratings.comment: This course was great. She's teaching eye-opening material, which clearly many below didn't digest. She doesn't preach her opinion in lecture. She uses research and academic works to convey messages about institutional discrimination. No exams! Essays were a bit tough. Readings were easy (but long). Fair grader. Always willing to help. Recommended!

The class material was the worst part about this class. It's a lot of sensitive topics about racism. However, if you just do the weekly work and put in a few hours a week, you'll get a good grade. This is great for the ethnic studies requirement.

Side note: this class isn't about white guilt! She stresses that white people shouldn't feel guilty about their whiteness - just aware. :) If you do oppose an idea in the class, she wasn't condescending. She wants to engage with her students in a positive way. Overall, I'd recommend her over other profs! She's SO helpful if you just reach out.

Interesting class. I usually follow liberal beliefs, but this class is extremely one sided to the point where I developed an annoyance to it. Other than that we had no exams, but short analysis essays and weekly write ups.
Good Prof.  No tests and readings, lectures and assignments parallel each other.

If you have conservative views, stay away from this class! The textbook taught from is written by a liberal extremist, therefore the class is taught from a very one-sided perspective. Aside from that, Rachel Fish is an effective lecturer and grades assignments fairly. If taking the class, I would definitely recommend taking it with her!!

This class was definitely the highlight of my first semester at UW- Madison. In the beginning  of the semester, she moved sort pf fast during lecture but them slowed down after she got feedback from us in our midterm evaluations. Overall, great professor and you can tell she really cares about what she teaches.

She was a great teacher and her lectures were really interesting.  I never post on rate my professor but I had to when I saw the comment about her blaming white people for all the world's problems and promoting socialism.  First of all, you are a complete idiot.  And secondly, get over yourself.  Those are both untrue statements.

At first the class seem overwhelming. Then the final was optional and essays were taken away. The final exam was easy too. Not the best with technology, but it doesn't interfere with her lecture. Easy class and she was also pregnant. Just saying.
A grad student who overwhelms her students with busy work and doesn't know how to work technology.
